Other Algorithms & Embedded Designs

2019 – 2020

Environmental Control System

This project addresses the growing demand for user-friendly, intelligent management of planting, incubation, factory equipment, and smart-home environments. Centered on a cloud-based monitoring platform, the system integrates data acquisition, analysis, and control to maintain strict environmental conditions and provide timely alerts. Key components include:

  • Cloud Monitoring Center – Collects, stores, and analyzes real-time temperature, humidity, light, and gas data while running predictive algorithms to forecast trends.
  • LoRa + GPRS Data Network – A dual-mode wireless backbone that ensures reliable, long-range transmission from distributed sensor nodes to the cloud.
  • Edge Gateway – A configurable MCU-based gateway that aggregates sensor data, executes local safety logic, and relays commands from the cloud to actuators.
  • Mobile Client – Enables users to view live dashboards, receive alarms, and remotely adjust environmental parameters anytime, anywhere.

Line-Following Intelligent Car

To overcome the low accuracy, slow response, and poor adaptability of conventional line-following robots, this project proposes an adaptive speed-controlled intelligent car for complex environments. Core features include:

  • MSP430F149 Main Controller – Handles sensor fusion, motor control, and real-time decision making with low power consumption.
  • Infrared Sensor Array with Max-Angle Layout – Multiple IR pairs are time-multiplexed and shielded by light-blocking baffles to maintain precise path detection under varying ambient light.
  • Adaptive Speed Control – The car dynamically adjusts velocity according to turning radius; initial speed is set via on-board buttons and displayed on an LCD, with non-volatile storage to retain settings after power-down.
  • Stop-Line Detection & Voice Control – The system recognizes stop lines for accurate halting and supports voice commands to start or stop the vehicle.
  • DC Geared Motors – Provide stable propulsion with feedback for closed-loop speed regulation.

This design achieves high-precision tracking, fast response, and broad environmental compatibility—making it suitable for educational demos, warehouse logistics, and autonomous navigation research.
